MCQ: Who coined the term machine learning in 1959?
Choices: a:Alan Turing|b:Arthur Samuel|c:Donald Hebb|d:Tom M. Mitchell

MCQ: What was the earliest machine learning model introduced by Arthur Samuel in the 1950s?
Choices: a:Speech recognition system|b:Weather prediction model|c:Checkers winning chance calculator|d:Stock trading algorithm

MCQ: What is the main purpose of modern-day machine learning?
Choices: a:To classify data based on models|b:To make predictions for future outcomes|c:Both a and b|d:None of the above

MCQ: What did Raytheon Company develop in the early 1960s for analyzing sonar signals, electrocardiograms, and speech patterns?
Choices: a:Cybertron learning machine|b:Speech recognition system|c:Weather prediction model|d:Checkers winning chance calculator

MCQ: Who proposed the early mathematical models of neural networks to come up with algorithms that mirror human thought processes?
Choices: a:Arthur Samuel|b:Donald Hebb|c:Tom M. Mitchell|d:Raytheon Company

MCQ: What formal definition of machine learning algorithms was provided by Tom M. Mitchell?
Choices: a:A computer program learns from experience E with respect to some class of tasks T and performance measure P|b:A computer program can think like a human|c:A computer program can predict the future accurately|d:A computer program can only perform tasks it is explicitly programmed for
